content:
Diagnosis:		Papillary thyroid carcinoma

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		pT1aN0M0 papillary thyroid carcinoma
		BRAF and RAS mutation negative

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. Thyroglobulin remains undetectable at <0.1 ng/mL. TSH is well-controlled at 0.3 mU/L on current levothyroxine dose. Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy. Latest ultrasound neck from 15/12/23 showed no evidence of recurrence. The plan is to continue current levothyroxine dose and arrange repeat thyroglobulin and TSH in 6 months with follow-up appointment.

cancer_timeline.value: Ultrasound neck showed no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features, no palpable cervical lymphadenopathy
TSH well-controlled at 0.3 mU/L on current levothyroxine dose

status_updates.value: Early stage papillary thyroid cancer treated with surgery and radioactive iodine. Currently no evidence of disease recurrence on surveillance.
Repeat thyroglobulin and TSH in 6 months
